results.title: Interviews with My Lai veterans
results.creator_credit: Laser Film Corporation and Joseph Strick
results.brief_description: Five American soldiers present their recollections of the events at My Lai, Vietnam on 16th March 1968. During their interviews such matters as the training of soldiers, the strategy of My Lai and the details of the massacre are discussed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Interviews
results.creator_credit: Harris Watts, Mike Crisp and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “On camera: the BBC video production course”.
Deals with interview techniques both inside and outside the studio. Shows how to shoot an interview using either one or two cameras. Diagrams are used to relate camera position, interviewer and guest to what appears on the scree. The importance of cutaways, shot sizes and the positioning of props are also covered.

results.title: Interviewing: the process
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how decision analysis techniques can be used to achieve objective evaluations in a range of situations, such a personnel recruitment interviews, product evaluation, customer service evaluation. A manual complements the video and may be loaned as a separate item.

results.title: Interviewing the Abused Child.
results.brief_description: Through a series of actual and recreated interviews, children of various ages, subjected to different types of abuse, are seen and heard as professionals talk with them. A perceptive training film which will benefit anyone with an occasion to interview a child abuse victim

results.title: Interviewing for local selection. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions and Stephen Skok
results.brief_description: The first part shows many of the pitfalls which may be encountered by a selection panel which has not adequately prepared itself for its important task. The second part shows how a well organised panel conducts interviews for principal selection.

results.title: Interviewing and hiring: getting it right the first time
results.creator_credit: Clifton Hill Productions, The Public Record and Peter Campbell
results.brief_description: The importance of selecting the right person for the job and the implications to your business if you don’t are highlighted in this 30 minute video. The 4 classic mistakes that hirers make - failure to fully read and understand the candidate’s CV, poor questioning techniques in the interview, excessive talking by the interviewer, and inadequate verification with previous employers - are clearly explained by presenter Sandy Kaye and illustrated through live footage. Covers issues such as job titles, exaggerated claims, education and training, references and testimonials and the importance of open and behavioural questioning. A complimentary participants guide accompanies the video which allows pausing between each mistake addressed. Whilst aimed at employers/interviewers this video is equally useful for job seekers who want to know how to conduct oneself in an interview. Written by Bruce Storey.

results.title: Interview with the boss
results.creator_credit: Ian Woolf, Tony Matthews and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Interaction”.
Part 5 of a series of films for managers. Discusses ways in which employer and employee can develop a working relationship. Documents an appraisal interview at IBM which is replayed to the supervisor and staff member who then discuss their reactions. Introduced by Brian Redhead.
